chapter.title: Roles
chapter.para: The rel="roles" link obtained from the entry point URI (see ) provides access to a static set of system roles. Each individual role element contains the following:

note.title: Element property icons
note.para: The icons used in the properties column of this table are described in

row.entry: The role name (used as a more convenient identifier in any role-specific operations)
A free-text description of the role
A reference to the associated user (only present in the context of the role represented being assigned to an individual user)

example.title: An XML representation of the roles collection
example.screen:
GET /rhevm-api/roles HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/xml
<roles> <role id="00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001" href="/rhevm-api/roles/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"> <name>SuperUser</name> <description>Roles management administrator</description> </role> <role id="00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000001" href="/rhevm-api/roles/00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000001"> <name>RHEVMUser</name> <description>RHEVM user</description> </role> <role id="00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000002" href="/rhevm-api/roles/00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000002"> <name>RHEVMPowerUser</name> <description>RHEVM power user</description> </role> <role id="00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000003" href="/rhevm-api/roles/00000000-0000-0000-0001-000000000003"> <name>RHEVMVDIUser</name> <description>RHEVM VDI user</description> </role> </roles>

note.para: Because the global roles form a static set in Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager, the standard common features are not followed in this case, i.e. roles cannot be created via POST nor destroyed via DELETE on the collection.

section.title: Permits Sub-Collection
section.para: Each role contains a set of allowable actions, or permits, which are defined in capabilities. For more information on permits, see .
A role's permits are listed as a sub-collection:

example.title: Listing a role's permits
example.screen:
GET /rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/xml
<permits> <permit id="1" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits/1"> <name>CREATE_VM</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role id="b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9"/> </permit> <permit id="4" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits/4"> <name>VM_BASIC_OPERATIONS</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role id="b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9"/> </permit> </permits>

section.para: Assign a permit to a role with a POST request to the permits sub-collection. Use either an id attribute or a name element to specify the permit to assign.

example.title: Assign a permit to a role
example.screen:
POST /rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
<permit id="1"/>
HTTP/1.1 201 Created Content-Type: application/xml
<permits> <permit id="1" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9/permits/1"> <name>CREATE_VM</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role id="b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9" href="/rhevm-api/roles/b67dfbe2-0dbc-41e4-86d3-a2fbef02cfa9"/> </permit> </permits>
